marketNews.title: US Inflation Cools to 3.4% YoY, In Line with Expectations
marketNews.content:
U.S. inflation slowed to an annual rate of 3.4% year-over-year (YoY) in April 2024 (versus March 2024: 3.5% YoY), in line with consensus expectations and ending a three-month streak of readings above expectations. On a month-over-month basis, inflation eased to 0.3% MoM (versus March 2024: 0.4% MoM), lower than the consensus forecast of 0.4% MoM.

Core inflation also eased to 0.3% MoM and 3.6% YoY in April 2024 (versus March 2024: 0.4% MoM and 3.8% YoY), matching expectations and marking the lowest annual core inflation in three years.

Nevertheless, the annual inflation rate remains above the Federal Reserve’s target of 2% YoY.

The three major U.S. equity indices rose to fresh highs after the inflation release on Wednesday (15 May) local time, with the Nasdaq up 1.4%, the S&P 500 up 1.17% and the DJIA up 0.88%. On the same day, the 10-year U.S. Treasury yield fell 10 basis points to 4.34%.

Indonesia’s capital market was also positively affected, with the Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) gaining 0.93%, the 10-year Indonesian government bond yield falling 5 basis points to 6.93%, and the rupiah strengthening 0.8% to IDR 15,944 per U.S. dollar.

Key Takeaway

The easing of inflation and its alignment with expectations reinforces the narrative of a Federal Reserve rate-cut cycle. According to the CME FedWatch Tool, the market’s consensus now expects the Fed to begin cutting rates in September 2024, with the probability rising from 69.6% on 6 May 2024 to 89.84% on Thursday (16 May).

A potential Fed rate cut and a faster-than-expected Bank Indonesia easing could boost sentiment for the banking, property and technology sectors. Several issuers in those sectors posted strong gains on the day, including $BBNI +3.48%, $SMRA +7.48% and $BUKA +2.42%.

tickerNews.title: EXCL and FREN Officially Explore Merger Plan
tickerNews.content: The controlling shareholder of XL Axiata, Axiata Group Bhd., together with the controlling shareholder of Smartfren Telecom (FREN) and the Sinar Mas group, announced that they have signed a non-binding memorandum of understanding to explore a merger between EXCL and FREN. The announced merger, coming three weeks after a Bloomberg report at the end of April 2024 that the deal would be completed in the coming months, would create a new corporate entity with total assets of approximately IDR 133 trillion, the second-largest in Indonesia.

tickerNews.title: INCO Extends Mining Licence to 28 Dec 2035
tickerNews.content: Vale Indonesia announced that it has obtained an extension of its mining licence until 28 December 2035 following the issuance of a Special Mining Business License (IUPK) on 13 May 2024. The extension is part of the divestment agreement for 14% of INCO’s shares from Vale SA and Sumitomo Metal Mining Co. to MIND ID. As part of the licence extension, INCO is also required to complete the construction of a smelter.

tickerNews.title: INTP Reports 10.4% YoY Cement Sales Growth in April 2024
tickerNews.content: Indocement Tunggal Prakarsa reported a 10.4% year-over-year increase in cement sales volume in April 2024, raising its total market share to 30.7% (versus 28.2% in April 2023) thanks to consolidation of Semen Grobogan. Sales growth was driven by Java Island (+18.3% YoY), lifting its Java market share to 39.8% (versus 35.3% in April 2023). Outside Java, sales volume fell 1.6% YoY, while market share held at 21.7%. National cement sales volume rose 1.5% YoY in April 2024.

tickerNews.title: SIDO Declares IDR 540 B Final Dividend for FY 2023
tickerNews.content: Sido Muncul announced a final dividend for the 2023 fiscal year of IDR 540 billion, or IDR 18 per share. The dividend is payable on 6 June 2024 with record-date on 27 May 2024. Based on a closing price of IDR 715 per share on Thursday (16 May), the implied final dividend yield is 2.5%. Previously, SIDO also paid an interim dividend of IDR 378 billion (IDR 12.6 per share) in November 2023.

tickerNews.title: CUAN Acquires Full Stake in B4 and 30% of B3
tickerNews.content: Petrindo Jaya Kreasi announced that it has acquired 100% of PT Borneo Bangun Banua Bestari (B4) and signed an agreement to acquire 30% of PT Borneo Bangun Banua (B3). The transaction values were not disclosed. B3 holds a mining licence for Central Kalimantan, while B4 owns 99.9% of B3. The acquisitions align with the company’s plan to add assets, expand operations and increase coal production capacity.

tickerNews.title: DOID Proposes 5% Capital Reduction
tickerNews.content: Delta Dunia Makmur plans to reduce its authorized capital by buying back 409.9 million treasury shares, equivalent to 5% of the issued and paid-in capital. The move is intended to enhance shareholder value and create a more efficient capital structure. After the transaction, the paid-in capital will fall from IDR 1.35 trillion to IDR 389.4 billion. The proposal will be discussed at the shareholders’ meeting on 21 June 2024.

tickerNews.title: WIKA’s New Contract Value Falls 35.2% YoY to IDR 5.68 Trillion
tickerNews.content: Wijaya Karya reported a 35.2% year-over-year decline in new contract value to IDR 5.68 trillion in the first four months of 2024, representing 15.4% of the 2024 target of IDR 37 trillion.

tickerNews.title: KLBF Approves IDR 1.4 Trillion Dividend for FY 2023
tickerNews.content: Shareholders of Kalbe Farma approved a dividend for the 2023 fiscal year of IDR 1.4 trillion, or IDR 31 per share. The record date and payment date have not been announced. Based on a closing price of IDR 1,445 per share on Thursday (16 May), the implied dividend yield is 2.1%.

tickerNews.title: MIDI Approves IDR 155.5 B Dividend for FY 2023
tickerNews.content: Shareholders of Midi Utama Indonesia approved a dividend for the 2023 fiscal year of approximately IDR 155.5 billion, or IDR 4.65 per share. The record date and payment date have not been announced. Based on a closing price of IDR 392 per share on Thursday (16 May), the implied dividend yield is 1.2%.

tickerNews.title: BABP Plans Private Placement of Up to IDR 4.4 B
tickerNews.content: Bank MNC Internasional plans to conduct a private placement of up to approximately IDR 4.4 billion (10% of the company’s shares) with a potential dilution of up to 9.09%. The issue price and ratio were not disclosed; proceeds will be used to boost credit and further develop the MotionBank digital banking platform. The proposal will be discussed at the extraordinary shareholders’ meeting on 21 June 2024.

tickerNews.title: HILL Increases Stake in Itself by 15.2 Million Shares
tickerNews.content: Hillcon Equity Management, the controlling shareholder of Hillcon, purchased approximately 15.2 million HILL shares at IDR 3,200 per share on 14 May 2024, for a total transaction value of about IDR 48.8 billion. After the transaction, Hillcon’s ownership in HILL increased from 40.71% to 41.23%.

tickerNews.title: BNBR Plans Quasi-Reorganization to Eliminate IDR 19.5 Trillion Deficit
tickerNews.content: Bakrie & Brothers intends to carry out a quasi-reorganization using the consolidated financial statements as of 31 December 2023. The restructuring will eliminate a profit-and-loss deficit of IDR 19.5 trillion for 2023. In exchange, share capital will be reduced from roughly IDR 23.7 trillion to IDR 4.6 trillion, the non-controlling interest balance will fall from about IDR 519 billion to zero, and the share premium account will rise from about IDR 61.7 billion to IDR 120.6 billion. Equity remains around IDR 2.7 trillion. The plan will be discussed at the extraordinary shareholders’ meeting on 21 June 2024.

tickerNews.title: WSKT Announces Bond Payment Postponement and Delisting Risk
tickerNews.content: Waskita Karya’s corporate secretary Ermy Puspa Yunita said the company targets an effective financial restructuring in the first half of 2024. The company is currently communicating with all stakeholders to obtain approval of a restructuring scheme from bondholders and banks. However, on Wednesday (15 May) WSKT announced a postponement of interest and principal payments on its 2019 Series B Phase III-IV bonds amounting to IDR 1.36 trillion. WSKT currently faces a risk of delisting after its shares have been suspended on the IDX for more than 12 months since 8 May 2023 due to the delayed bond payments.

tickerNews.title: BBNI, SMRA and BUKA Post Strong Gains Amid Fed-Rate-Cut Sentiment
tickerNews.content: BBNI posted a gain of 3.48% on the day, while $SMRA rose 7.48% and $BUKA advanced 2.42% as the banking, property and technology sectors received a sentiment boost from expectations of a Fed-rate cut and a potentially faster Bank Indonesia easing cycle.
